[...]α̣[... ἐπρ]ί̣ατο [. 4.]ας Νικ[c. 6 - 8]
[πὰρ] Καλικ[ρ]άτειας̣ [τᾶ]ς̣ ̣Α̣ἰσχύλ[ου c. 4 - 6]
[Ἄμ]π̣ποχοι Νι̣κίας Σωσ[ί]α τρί(τα) κα(ὶ) δ[εκάτα]
5[Σά]τυρος Ἀρίστωνος τρί(τα) καὶ δε[κ]ά[τα]
[Φίλ?]ανδρος Γ⟦λα⟧υκία τετάρ«τ»α δευτ̣[έρα]
[Φιλ?]ωνίδας Ἡρ{⟦αρ⟧}ακλείδα τρί(τα) καὶ δ[εκάτα]
[Δα]μάτριος Κρίθωνος ἑβδέμα δε̣υ(τέ)ρα
[Φι]λόδωρος Κρίθωνος ἑβδέμα [δ]ετέρα̣
10( vac. 1 line)

Apparatus criticus

Text is from Souza 2016, integrating two joining fragments to the three consituting the document published by Cordano and Dubois.; [ἐν πλ]ατεία[ι], M.;[πλ]α̣τεία[ι?] , D.
4: [Γλαυ]κίας, D.
6: The lambda in Glaukias' name has a crossbar, which is perhaps why it was crossed out.τετάρτα, D.

English translation

...--as son of Nik-- bought...from Kalikrateia the daughter of Aischylos. Guarantors: Nikias son of Sosias thirteenth (phratry), Saturos son of Ariston thirteenth (phratry), Philandros(?) son of Glaukias fourth (phratry)-??? (tribe), Philonidas(?) son of Herakleidas thirteenth (phratry), Damatrios son of Krithon seventh (phratry)-second (tribe), Philodoros son of Krithon seventh (phratry)-second (tribe).

commentary

With this document we have yet another female seller of property who may be, conservatively, the daughter of Aischylos, or more likely, his widow, depending on restorations in empty spaces.
